item.title: Best Creative Storage Ideas For Your Home
item.dc:creator: cfit
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Sometimes, it might seem like there's never enough space inside your home. You might trip over objects that are on the floor or find yourself looking for more drawers or locations to put clothes or other linens. Fortunately, there are a few creative storage solutions to consider. An option for larger items or seasonal belongings is to use a Sydney Self Storage facility until you have other solutions inside or outside your home.

Sliding racks

Slide-out racks can be installed inside your kitchen or bathroom cabinets so that you have an area to hang everything from pots and pans to tools that are used to style your hair. You can install as many racks as you want based on the space that you have in the cabinet. A benefit of this idea is that you can adjust the racks to suit the sizes of the items that you're storing. A Sydney Self Storage facility can be used for large appliances and furnishings until you have the racks installed and can better organise your home.

Racks on the counters

Magazine racks are a storage idea to consider if you have limited space. They can be used to hold books, magazines, sheet pans, lids, and other flat objects that take up room in your drawers and cabinets. These racks can also be placed on kitchen counters to store aluminium foil and plastic wrap boxes since most of them are the same width. If you want to hide the rack, then install it on the inside of a cabinet where you keep cooking supplies.

Hidden containers

Keep your produce off the counters and hidden from view by installing plastic containers in your kitchen drawers. Add lids to the containers to keep items like potatoes, onions, and bread fresh until it's ready to be used. When foods are in the containers, you need to check them to ensure that they aren't going bad before you use them when making meals.

Shelving systems

Thinner shelves are an option to consider inside cabinets or on walls. They take up less space than those that are thicker, which means that you can install more shelves for more storage. Large items that won't fit inside the cabinets and that you don't want to throw away can be taken to a Sydney Self Storage facility until you can use them in your home. You can also utilise the space underneath the shelves if they are placed over a counter or another solid surface. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Top 5 Tips For Home Renovations
item.dc:creator: Harry_Hart
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" type="1_1" first="true"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] A home renovation can be an exciting adventure. It means that you're changing the way that an area of your home looks and likely improving the function of that area as well. Before you begin the renovation process, there are a few tips to keep in mind so that you get just the design that you want. Items that are in the way during the renovation can be taken to a Sydney Storage unit until you're ready to put them back in your home.

The end design

Make a plan for what you want the renovation to look like at the end of the project. This will make it easier to plan for the materials that are used, the colours and patterns that are incorporated, and the larger design details that will be put in place. Examples of the goals that you might have in mind include changing the appearance in order to sell the home in the future or creating more space for your family to enjoy.

Budget

Create a budget that you can afford instead of one that could possibly result in being in debt. Consider the details that you can push ahead to another project and those that you desire right away as this can make it a bit easier to decide on a budget that is easy to maintain. Talk to companies about possible discounts if you pay in cash for materials and the work that is performed if you don't plan on doing the renovation yourself.

Packing

A Sydney Storage unit is an option for removing items in your home that are in the way, making it easier for the design team to work in your home. If you're renovating multiple rooms at one time, then you want to get as many items out of the rooms as possible. However, you still need to keep enough belongings so as not to disrupt the daily routine of your family members.

Control area

Establish an area of your home where workers can remove their shoes or where they can put on the gear needed to stay clean while inside your house. This should also be an area where materials are kept until they are needed so that everything isn't taken across the house.

Make a free area

Create an area in your home that's not disrupted by the renovation process. This should be an area where you can enjoy being with your family as you do each day. Items that you can't move into this area can be stored in a Sydney Storage unit until the renovation is complete. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Self-Storage 101: What Is it And How Does it Work? We’ve Got All the Answers You Need
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
If you’ve never rented storage space before, it is common to have basic questions about the process itself. As one of Sydney’s top storage facilities, we at Holloway Removals & Storage understand the idea of leaving some of your most prized possessions at a storage facility can be unsettling, so we’ve created what we like to call Self-Storage 101: What is it and how does is work? Here we will answer your questions so you can have full confidence when you decide to leave your treasured keepsakes and belongings with us.

What is self-storage?

Think of self-storage as that extra space you need that your home or apartment just doesn’t have. Depending on the space you require, a storage unit is essentially an extra closet or garage, providing the room you need for short- or long-term storage. There are many reasons why people choose to rent a storage unit:
  • It gives you a place to store seasonal items (like holiday decorations and/or seasonal clothing and equipment) that you only pull out once a year
  • During a move, if you must live in temporary housing until your new place is available, self-storage provides safe keeping for your belongings.
  • If your home is being remodeled, you may need a place to store furniture and housewares until the remodel is complete.
  • If you have vehicles you don’t regularly use (RV’s, motorcycles) or items like boats and other watercrafts, storage lets you keep them safe without them taking up precious real estate at your home.
  • If you have expensive collections requiring specialised storage, Holloway storage has custom solutions for high-value items like artwork, antiques, and even wine collections.

How Do I Choose the Right Size for My Storage Needs?

The short answer is—give us a call! We have a team of storage experts who will ask you a few questions to help you determine how much storage space you need. But if you’re looking for examples, we have those for you, too:

Small Self-Storage Space

A 1.5M x 1.5M x 2.9M (H) will hold approximately 10 – 20 boxes and is great for storing seasonal décor or documents. A 3M x 2M x 2.9M (H) is quite a bit larger and can hold the contents of a one-bedroom apartment. This provides plenty of box storage as well as space for living room and bedroom furniture.

Medium Self-Storage Space

A 4M x 3M x 2.9M (H) can easily hold the contents of a three-bedroom home and is perfect for holding large quantities of boxes and items in preparation for a move. A 5M x 3M x 2.9M (H) unit is the equivalent size of a small, single-car garage. It can store items from a 3–4-bedroom home or has space for small vehicles or trailers.

Large Self-Storage Space

An 8M x 3M x 2.9M (H) unit can accommodate belongings from a 5-6-bedroom household with room left over to store a vehicle. This size is also quite popular with business looking for a large, offsite storage location. If you only need storage for an RV, vehicle, or boat, look for units that are 5M – 10M in length.

How Do I Go About Renting a Self-Storage Unit?

Once you know what size self-storage unit you need, be sure to contact us at Holloway Removals & Storage. It’s best if you understand what your budget is for a storage unit going into the process. Keep in mind that storage prices vary depending on whether you need a unit that is indoor vs. outdoor or climate controlled, and the size of the unit you need. On your move-in day, be sure to bring identification and your reservation number (if you were given one). And don’t forget to bring your payment method of choice. When it comes to payments, most storage companies charge on a month-to-month basis, eliminating the hassle of long-term contracts…but you should confirm this with your storage company before signing paperwork.

Do Mobile Self-Storage Units Really Exist?

YES! Our mobile self-storage units are the perfect way to free up space in your home. Whether you’re just doing a bit of decluttering or need storage while downsizing, we provide convenient mobile storage. Our mobile units can be delivered across Sydney by our friendly and professional team, who will then return whenever you’re ready to transport the unit back to our secure facility. Gone are the days of hauling heavy boxes and furniture across town to store. Let us bring the unit to you!

How Secure Are Self-Storage Units?

At Holloway Storage, we employ the latest in security technology to keep our facility…and your belongings…safe and sound. Unlike other facilities, we carefully monitor the comings and goings of people in our facility. Our CCTV system is monitored around the clock, and we have 24hr security on site. So, what are you waiting for? Let our team of experts help you determine the self-storage space you need and get you moved in. We think you’ll be surprised just how easy the self-storage process can be.

item.title: 6 Benefits of Using Self-Storage That You May Not Know
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
There are many reasons why people opt to rent a storage unit. Some need them for short-term uses, like keeping extra furniture safe while staging a home to sell. Others need long-term storage options for extra vehicles or sporting equipment. But many people assume quality storage is an expensive option available only to society’s upper crust. Not so! Today we’ll look at 6 instances when using a storage unit comes in handy and discuss the options available to make sure you only pay for what you need.

Benefit #1: They are a LifeSaver When Moving

Is there a more stressful time in life than when you are moving into a new home? It’s hard to think of a situation that is more stress inducing, thanks to all the moving parts that must coordinate to get your old home sold and your things and family into your new place. Having a storage unit rented as you prepare to move can be a life saver. It’s great to use before the move when you are staging your house to sell. Most real estate agents will tell you to pare down furniture to create more negative space in the home. This makes it feel larger and less cluttered. But where do you put all the stuff that you’re removing from your home? You can’t hide it in the garage…potential buyers want to see that area looking as lovely as the rest of the house. Having a storage unit rented gives you a safe and secure place to store your stuff while you wait for your home to sell. It’s also great to have after the sale has taken place, particularly if you and your family must move into temporary housing until your new home is ready. A storage unit can hold everything but the essentials until your new home is move-in ready.

Benefit #2: A Safe Space for Family Heirlooms

We all have those treasured belongings that have been passed down in our family for generations. They hold tremendous sentimental value (and many are quite valuable) but they do not compliment your home décor. Renting a storage unit allows you to keep antiques, artwork, and other family treasures safe in a climate-controlled setting without having them taking up space in your home.

Benefit #3: A Temporary Place to Keep the Belongings of Adult Children

If you have a child off at university and are ready to convert their bedroom in your home into an office or exercise room but have nowhere to put their furniture and/or belongings, it may be time to rent a small storage unit. Doing so will allow you to transform your room while keeping your college kid’s belongings safe until he or she graduates from university and has a place of his or her own. It’s also a convenient place to store all the second-hand furniture and housewares you may pick up occasionally at flea markets and garage sales to help the graduate furnish their first home.

Benefit #4: Helps You Declutter Your Home

Living in a cluttered environment is more than an inconvenience—it can negatively impact your health. Recent research indicates that clutter can have a negative impact on our mental wellbeing and can cause our bodies to produce increased levels of cortisol, the stress hormone. Take care of your physical and mental health by reducing the clutter in your home. Renting a storage unit gives you space to move items out without having to get rid of them. You get to keep your treasures, your home gets a bit of a facelift, and your stress levels come back to normal. That sounds like a win/win/win to us.

Benefit #5: Provides a Home for Seasonal Items and Equipment

We all have those items we love, but they only get used at a certain time of year and spend the other 10 – 11 months taking up precious space in our garages, basements, or attics. Things like Christmas trees and holiday decorations and décor can take up a tremendous amount of space and can easily be kept in a storage unit. If you enjoy seasonal sports like water skiing, tubing, jet skiing, downhill skiing, or snowmobiling, you likely have equipment you enjoy only in certain seasons. Why not keep it out of the way and safely stored for the remainder of the year in a storage unit?

Benefit #6: Storage is Cost Effective

Whether you’re looking for long or short term, business or personal storage in Sydney, Holloway Mobile Self Storage has a comprehensive, cost-effective storage solution for you. Our team of storage experts can help you calculate exactly how much storage space your items require, ensuring that you’re only paying for what you need and nothing you don’t. Contact us today for a custom quote. We’ll make sure your belongings are safe and easily accessible to you when you need them.

item.title: Tips for Choosing the Right Self Storage Facility for Your Needs
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text] Selecting the right storage facility for your belongings can feel intimidating. After all, what if you choose one that is too small for your needs? What if you pick one that’s too big? If deciding which facility is just right for you has you feeling like Goldilocks, have no fear. We’ve gathered a list of tips and tricks to help you choose the right self storage facility based upon your individual needs. Let’s dive in!

Decide What’s Going in the Storage Unit

It is infinitely harder to select the right unit if you don’t have a clear idea of what’s going on. Take the time to start gathering items you want to store. Box them up (if you won’t need regular access to them) and create a pile in a spare bedroom or garage. Be sure to clearly label boxes with the contents should you need to find something while it is in storage. Knowing what is going to live in your storage unit will help you select a unit that can accommodate all your belongings without overpaying for a unit that is too large.

How Will You Use the Storage Unit

People rent units for a variety of reasons, and how you plan to use your unit may determine the type and size of unit you need. If your unit is nothing more than a holding space for all the extra stuff you had to clear out before listing your home for sale, and if you don’t plan on accessing anything in the unit until you move it out on moving day, you can get by with packing your unit from stem to stern with boxes and furniture. If, however, you’re using the unit long-term to store things you’ll need to access, you’ll want to opt for a larger unit. You may want to leave space for shelving units and will likely want aisles you can walk between. While it may be tempting to try to save money by cramming everything in a smaller unit, the hassle of having to unpack the space every time you need to access something will quickly become unbearable, and you’ll likely end up moving everything again for the added elbow room provided by a larger storage unit.

Pack Thoughtfully

As you’re placing things in your storage unit, put items you’ll use more often at the front of the unit, and items you don’t plan on removing until you empty the unit in the back.

Decide Whether You Need a Climate-Controlled Unit

As their name suggests, climate-controlled units regulate the atmosphere inside for temperature and humidity. Whether or not you need one will likely depend on where you live and what you’re storing. If you live in a dry, arid location, items in a non-climate-controlled unit made from wood are at risk of cracking or splitting. If you live in a humid environment, the contents of your unit could succumb to mold and mildew. While climate-controlled units are almost always more expensive, many renters find them to be worth the cost in the long run.

Consider the Location of Your Unit

Location matters…especially if you plan to visit your unit regularly to retrieve items from storage, so take that into consideration when choosing a facility. Just because the rent is cheaper on a unit outside of town, if you’re going to be making regular trips to the unit it is wise to factor in travel costs to the overall cost of the rental.

Shop Around

Pricing on storage units can vary wildly, so call several places and ask for quotes. Storage facilities sometimes run promotions, so be sure to ask when you call. And, if competitors are running a special deal, the facility that is closest to you may be willing to make you a deal to get your business.

Verify Your Insurance and Their Security

Call your insurance agency to find out if your current policy covers items in storage—not all policies do, so it is important to check. Some storage facilities offer an optional tenant protection program where, for an extra fee each month, the storage facility will pay for certain damages up to a specified dollar amount. It’s also important to factor in the level of security you’re getting with the price you pay for your unit. In this case, the cheapest option isn’t always the best. Ask the storage facility about fencing, video surveillance, and any other security measures they have in place. And when you decide it’s time to rent a self storage unit, we hope you’ll come visit us at Holloway Storage. Our team of experts can help you choose the unit that is perfect for the needs of you and your family. Not too big. Not too small. Just right. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Sydney Storage Unit 101: Everything You Need to Know to Keep Your Stuff Safe
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
People with an overabundance of “stuff” often choose to rent a storage unit, either as a short- or long-term solution to their storage woes. But many are slow to pull the trigger, and one of the most common reasons for hesitation is this— How safe is my stuff? It’s an important question to ask, especially if you are storing items that are highly valuable like collectibles, antiques, artwork, or heirlooms. You may have items that hold no monetary value, but are sentimentally priceless, so finding out exactly how secure items are while in storage is a wise idea. So….how safe are they? The short answer is, it depends on two factors—the quality of your storage facility…and you. We’ve gathered plenty of indicators that will determine if the storage facility you’re considering is a good one, and a few tips and tricks for you to implement to ensure your items stay safe and sound.

The Storage Facility

Storage facilities have plenty of responsibility to make sure the items they house are not susceptible to thieves, and it is important that customers know what to look for to know the difference between a well- and poorly maintained business.

Surveillance System

Ask your prospective facility if they have a surveillance system and what kind they use. Any storage facility worth their salt should have 24-hour surveillance throughout their property. They get bonus points if they use a digital system rather than an old-school version that requires tape. And if you find a facility that incorporates 24-hour surveillance with on-site security personnel? We’d say your belongings are in good hands, indeed.

Well Maintained Property

When you visit a storage facility, don’t just tour the units. Evaluate the property itself. Take a walk around the perimeter, keeping an eye out for broken fencing or fencing with holes in it. Does the facility use keypads to gain access to the units? If so, do they appear to be in working order? Be sure to visit the property after dark to check out the lighting. Is the exterior well lit in all areas of the property? If you have an indoor unit, does the facility provide motion sensor lighting indoors? Businesses that look to be in sub-par shape or are poorly lit often draw the attention of burglars, so if you see any of these warning signs, or if the property just doesn’t seem to be well kept, move on to the next facility on your list.

Access Control System

Any storage facility you’re considering should protect their customers by using an access control system at points of entry. These high-tech keypads require visitors to punch in a passcode to gain entry to the property. Having such security measures in place significantly reduces who can access the facility, and it provides a history of exactly who has visited the property should a burglary occur.

What You Can Do to Keep Your Stored Belongings Safe

It’s important to know that the responsibility for keeping your items safe doesn’t lie solely with the storage facility, and there is plenty you can do to protect your belongings.

Invest in a High-Quality Lock

There are plenty of locks out on the market at a variety of price points, so it can be tricky deciding which one to choose to protect your unit. Avoid bargain-basement websites that claim to sell top-notch locks for blowout prices—you’ll likely get what you pay for. It’s also important to get a lock that will fit your unit, and the employees at your facility should be able to help you with this. Disc locks are often considered the gold standard for storage units as they are difficult to cut. But, because they are so difficult to cut, you don’t want to lose your key…otherwise, it may be a while before you see your stuff again. Combination locks eliminate the risk of someone else stealing your key and accessing your belongings. The only way they’ll get in is if they pick the lock or you give them your combination.

Avoid Putting Red-Flag Items in Your Unit

There are some things that just don’t belong in storage because they are not covered by insurance—things like cash (you’d be surprised how many people use their storage unit as their bank), fireworks, explosives, and weapons.

Choose Indoor Storage if Possible

Indoor storage is usually pricier than an outdoor unit but, if you can afford it, it provides an additional layer of security. In addition to getting past the access control system at the entrance, thieves looking for a quick mark will likely have to access a keypad at the entrance of the indoor portion of the facility. Because most burglars are looking for the easiest target, they often choose an outdoor unit over indoor. And so… When you choose to leave your valuables with a storage facility, it is important to choose one that is well-staffed, well lit, and routinely surveilled. It is also important that you do everything within your power to keep your belongings safe. Both forces working together creates a superhero of sorts, committed to maintaining law and order and protecting what’s yours. Whether you’re looking for long or short term, business or personal storage in Sydney, Holloway Mobile Self Storage has a comprehensive, cost-effective storage solution for you. Our team of experts can help you choose the unit that is perfect for the needs of you and your family. Not too big. Not too small. Just right.

item.title: 6 Tips for Packing Your Sydney Mobile Storage Unit Like Pro
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
The popularity of pack-your-own mobile storage units in Sydney has exploded recently. Whether you are planning a move overseas or just need a place to safely store your belongings while your new home is being built, mobile storage units are a convenient way to pack away items you want to store without making multiple trips to a storage facility. If packing a mobile storage unit is in your future, we’ve gathered 6 tips and tricks to help you complete the process quickly and efficiently.

1. Declutter Before Requesting Your Mobile Storage Unit

Why spend time and money storing items you no longer want or use? Before ordering your mobile storage unit, take the time to go through your home and get rid of items that are broken or collecting dust in your closets. Begin by having a garage sale (why not make a little money to offset the storage costs?). Sell items that are in fair to good condition and be prepared to slash prices as the day goes on—after all, the goal is to get rid of stuff, not fund your child’s college education. We’ve even gone so far as to offer items free of charge for the last hour of the sale to unload as much as possible. If there are high-dollar items that don’t sell, consider listing them online. There are plenty of online marketplaces that can help you. For everything else that is left after the garage sale patrons have gone, consider donating to a local charity—many will accept items such as clothing, appliances, and furniture. Remember to be kind when you donate and avoid giving away stained or torn clothing or appliances that do not work.

2. Pack Carefully

The single most important tip for ensuring your items survive storage is to pack them well. Purchase quality cardboard boxes and have plenty of tape, packing paper, and packing peanuts on hand. Some storage companies include packing materials in with their service fees, so be sure to ask your storage rep before buying supplies. Be sure to reinforce the bottoms of your boxes with extra tape and pad your boxes with packing paper or peanuts. Each item should be well wrapped in packing paper or bubble wrap. You may also use household items like towels, blankets, and dish rags for extra padding. You should also have plenty of rope on hand to tie off items in the storage unit and keep everything secure, particularly large or bulky items like furniture. When packing, take care to place heavier items in smaller boxes, making them easier to carry. Pack boxes as tightly as possible without over packing and try to use boxes of similar size—this will make stacking boxes in your unit infinitely easier.

3. Pack Your Unit from Bottom to Top and Back to Front

People unfamiliar with packing sometimes assume they should line the floor of the mobile unit with boxes before adding the next level…not so. Begin at the back of the unit and stack boxes and items from the floor to ceiling as if you are creating a wall. Then step back toward the entrance of the unit and build your next wall. Continue until you have reached the front of the unit.

4. Spread Heavy Items Out Evenly

It is important to keep the weight of your items evenly distributed throughout the unit. Avoid placing all of your heavy furniture on one side of the storage unit. Instead, place heavy pieces like furniture and large items throughout the unit to keep it balanced.

5. Disassemble Furniture

Whether you’re packing a mobile storage unit or a removalist’s truck, consider this the golden rule of packing—if it comes apart, take it apart. Often, large pieces of furniture can be disassembled to make them easier to transport, so be sure to break down anything that can be taken apart. Doing so reduces the risk of damage during transport and storage. Remove legs from chairs and tables when possible and break large standing lamps into smaller pieces. If you have a wooden cabinet or armoire with glass in the doors, be sure to remove the glass and wrap it separately, then tape or tie the doors closed to make sure they don’t pop open during transport.

6. Speaking of Glass…Wrap Fragile Items

Even professional packers have the occasional mishap where things shift during moving. That’s why it is important to take extra care when packing fragile items that are easily breakable or susceptible to scratching. Carefully wrap glass items in multiple layers of bubble wrap and cover wooden furniture with moving blankets to reduce the risk of breaks or scratches should something come loose during transport. Once you’ve packed your mobile storage unit, the only step left is to call your storage company and schedule a pickup appointment. They will carefully transport your unit back to their facility and safely store your items until you’re ready to have them returned to you. If you’re looking for a mobile storage unit in Sydney, Holloway Mobile Self Storage has a comprehensive, cost-effective storage solution for you. Our team of experts can help you choose the unit that is perfect for the needs of you and your family. Not too big. Not too small. Just right.

item.title: Top Reasons Holloway is the Sydney Self Storage Facility of Your Dreams
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to self-storage, we know you have plenty of options. According to High Street Residentials, there are more than 2,000 self-storage facilities in Australia and New Zealand. Here at Holloway, we know that, in order to stand out from the crowd, it isn’t enough to be good at what we do—we have to be exceptional. We’ve worked hard over the years to build a business that is centered around the comfort and convenience of our customers, and this client-first mentality affects every aspect of what we do. Today, we thought we’d share with you 6 reasons why storing your belongings with us in Sydney is the best choice you can make.

1. We Deliver Right to Your Door

One of the biggest hassles with storing your belongings is getting them to and from the storage facility. Depending on the amount of stuff you have, it can be akin to moving homes, requiring several back-and-forth trips, the enlisting of friends to help, and the renting of a truck. At Holloway, we eliminate the hassle and deliver as many storage units as you need directly to your door. No truck rental needed, my friend. And we deliver across the wider Sydney region to both businesses and residences.

2. We’re Happy to Pack

Even with the storage unit right outside your door, packing it up can be intimidating, especially if you have large pieces of furniture that need to be moved or are unsure how to maximise the space in your unit. If you just aren’t up to tackling the packing, we’re here to help. Our expert team is happy to pack your storage unit for you, and they’ll likely accomplish the task in a fraction of the time it would take you to complete—after all, packing is what we do. And moving large pieces of furniture and equipment is what we train for. We can navigate tight turns and lift heavy items, saving you from potential injury and your belongings from damage. As far as packing goes, our team uses tetris-like precision to ensure the space in your unit is fully maximized.

3. We Take Good Care of Your Belongings

Once your unit is securely packed, just give us a call and we’ll pick up your unit and move it to our state-of-the-art storage facility. We are grateful when customers choose to entrust us with their belongings, and we take that trust seriously. Our facility boasts 24/7 CCTV security footage, and we have trained security personnel on site. We also enforce restricted access hours to further ensure the safety of your items. All our units are equipped with durable and well-sealed waterproof coverings that ensure your property stays dry. And the unit itself is the industry’s latest breathable, wooden module, which further protects your valuables from dampness and mould. When you are ready to have your unit returned to you, simply give us a call. We will deliver your unit to you, wherever you are, within 24 hours.

4. We are Experienced & Fully Insured

We have been putting customers first and taking the hassle out of the storage process for over a decade. And during that time, we’ve built a strong reputation as Sydney’s top storage facility and a loyal following amongst our clients. Whether you need help with packing, moving, and heavy lifting or only need us to supply boxes and packing materials, we’ve got you covered. And, unlike some facilities in the area, Holloway is fully insured against any losses that may occur during transit.

5. We Offer Competitive Pricing

We are firm believers that quality service doesn’t have to break the bank. We encourage you to call around and compare our rates to those of our competitors. We think you’ll find you get quite a bit of bang for your buck with us, particularly when you compare the quality of the units and the security of the facility. If you do happen to find someone offering a better deal, just let us know. We are happy to price match with our competitors, so you can rest assured you’re always getting the best deal around with Holloway.

6. We’re Well Reviewed

We’re proud of the job we do for our customers and grateful when those we serve take the time to leave us their reviews on Google. It’s always a good idea to look over the reviews of any storage facility you’re considering, and it doesn’t hurt to ask them for recommendations. We’re always happy to connect potential clients with satisfied customers. When the time comes to store your belongings for the short- or long-term, we hope you’ll contact us at Holloway Storage. Our expert team will be happy to offer you a custom quote with as much…or as little…help as you need. Store your belongings the right way…with Holloway.

item.title: 6 Ways Your Sydney Self-Storage Company Can Help You During the Holidays
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text]Having friends and family come together during the holiday season is a tradition many of us look forward to each year…but it can also bring its own share of stress as you try to prepare your home for the increase in visitors and guests. It brings to mind the holiday movie classic, National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation. As Clark Griswold invites extended family to spend the holiday in their home, his frazzled wife, Ellen bemoans, “I think you’re forgetting how difficult it’s going to be having everybody at the house at the same time.” No truer words have ever been spoken, but the influx in guests doesn’t have to ruin your Christmas spirit if you consider renting a self-storage unit during the holidays. Did the lightbulb just go off over your head? Are you currently asking yourself, Now why didn’t I think of that? The truth is many people assume self-storage units are reserved for those who are storing items long-term or are in the process of moving. Not so. Self-storage units are perfect for short-term storage during the holidays for a variety of reasons…and we’re betting some of the ideas that made our list have never occurred to you. Let’s take a look.

1. Use it to free up space in guest rooms.

If you’re like most of us, your guest bedroom has taken on a second persona—home office, workout room, crafting closet. Odds are, the bed is covered under layers of stuff that has yet to find a home. Self-storage provides that extra space you need to uncover the bed and clear out the crafting tables or office desk, so your guests can enjoy their own little hideaway during the holidays. Be sure to clean out the closet and a few drawers in the bedroom dresser so your visitors have a place to store their clothes.

2. Out with the clutter, in with the holiday décor.

It can often be challenging trying to figure out where to place your holiday tree and other Christmas décor that takes up space. Oftentimes, a chair is moved out of the room and into—you guessed it—the guest bedroom, to make space for the Christmas tree. Use your self-storage unit to safely store excess furniture and make more room for your family and friends to relax and mingle.

3. Protect your valuable collections.

With the increased number of people in your home, the chances increase that items on shelves and/or side tables can get knocked off or broken. Why not protect your treasured and fragile collectibles by storing them during the holiday season? Not only will your items be protected, but you’ll also be freeing up room for more seasonal décor.

4. It’s a great place to hide gifts.

We’re betting this idea never occurred to you. We all have that one family member who is bound and determined to uncover Christmas gifts before the gift exchange. Storing unwrapped packages in your self-storage unit ensures your junior detective will be clueless about what he or she is getting until it’s time to unwrap the gifts.

5. It keeps your stuff safe while you’re out of town.

Perhaps you are not hosting Christmas festivities this year. You may be travelling out of town to spend the holiday with your family. If this is the case, self-storage is a great way to safely store your valuables while you’re out of town. If you’re wondering whether self-storage is really necessary while you’re away from home, consider this—according to the NSW Bureau of Crime Statistics and Research, property crimes are a whopping 23% higher on Christmas Eve than they are for any other day of the year. Renting a self-storage unit gives you a safe and secure place to store valuables while you’re away from your home.

6. Renting a mobile self-storage unit is easy and convenient.

We know what you’re thinking—renting a storage unit and moving everything is going to consume more time than you have given as you prepare for the holidays. Consider renting a mobile self-storage unit. Unlike traditional storage units that require you to move everything to them, mobile units come to you. These high-tech units can be delivered anywhere on your property. You load them from the comfort of your own home, then call the storage facility to come pick it up. The company will safely store your items until after the holidays. Just give them 24-hour notice and they will have your unit returned to your home, ready to be unpacked. And there you have it—six stellar reasons you should consider renting a Sydney self-storage unit this holiday season. Packing away non-essential items will give guests more room, lower your stress levels, and allow you to enjoy time with your family and friends. And what could be better than that?[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: From Your Favorite Sydney Storage Pros: 8 Ways Self Storage Can Save Your Small Business
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text]There are times you expect to use a storage unit—if you have a large, seasonal item (we’re looking at you, boat owners) that you don’t want to keep at your home year-round, or if you’re moving and need to clear space to make the home going up for sale feel bigger and less cluttered. But have you ever thought of using self-storage to help your small business? The question may surprise you, but we think you’ll be surprised when you hear just how valuable storage units can be to small business owners. Have we piqued your curiosity? Let’s take a look at 8 ways renting a storage unit can benefit your Sydney business.

1. Reduce General Office Clutter

A recent study conducted by Princeton University found that clutter makes it more difficult for people to focus on specific tasks. And, according to the International Data Corporation, cluttered workspaces can cost businesses over $3.5 million annually due to lost productivity. Renting a storage unit provides business owners a place to store all the extra items that are lying around the office but no longer needed for everyday use.

2. Allows For Bulk Purchasing

Did you know renting a storage unit can actually save you money? Having access to additional space allows you to purchase and store inventory in bulk, which usually equates to a lower price point for you. Not only that, buying in bulk also reduces the number of times you have to order products…and pay for shipping…each year.

3. Reduces Expenses

As their business grows, many owners feel as though they’re left with “either/or” options for expansion—either stay in your current space, enjoying lower rent but suffering in tight quarters, or pay out the nose for a larger office that may be bigger than you currently need. It can feel as if there is no in between. Storage units offer a middle-of-the-road option, with low rates for extra space that allows you to stay in your current office until you have the funds to upgrade to a larger space.

4. Offers Flexibility

Storage units are available in a variety of sizes and at different price points. This allows business owners to tailor the size of their unit according to their needs. Whether you are a lawn service needing plenty of space to store large equipment or a medical office needing the equivalent of an extra closet to store old records, storage units can provide you with exactly what you need and not a centimeter more.

5. Keeps Your Belongings Safe & Secure

According to Australian Federal Police statistics, office place theft costs Aussie businesses up to $1.5 billion each year. Although it is becoming commonplace for office items to disappear, using a storage unit can help. Renting a storage unit allows you to keep workplace extras—pens, office supplies, or reams of paper—safely stored outside of the office and away from sticky fingers. Additionally, a reputable storage facility has some of the best security money can buy including 24/7 closed-circuit television monitoring and on-site security staff.

6. Keeps Your Office Space Free of Rarely Used Files & Documents

All businesses are required to keep certain records at the ready—former employee files, permits, tax records, and lease agreements to name a few—in the event someone needs to see them, but they usually end up taking up much needed space in your office. If your business is in the legal or medical fields, you likely have significantly more files to keep than a standard business owner and would likely benefit from renting a unit for your mountain of paperwork. Renting a storage unit gives your business a place to safely store such documentation, keeping it out of the way but easily available should you need to produce papers for a given year.

7. Best for Businesses with Bulky Equipment

If you own a business that uses large, specialised equipment—say a landscaping, tree-trimming, or house painting business—you likely own a variety of equipment that is only used in certain circumstances for certain projects. Renting a storage unit allows you to keep your equipment safely stored at a central location without taking up real estate at your office.

8. Climate Controlled Units are Perfect for Retailers

You may be thinking, “Sure, storage units are great for equipment or documents…but what about those who sell merchandise?” It just so happens that climate-controlled storage units can solve your problem, providing the extra space you need while reducing humidity and maintaining ambient temperatures to ensure your merchandise remains in tip-top condition. And so… Self-storage really can be the magic solution to your business storage problems. If you are a business owner in the Sydney area and are interested in renting a quality storage unit, contact us at Holloway Storage. We’ll deliver a storage module right to your business, allowing you to pack at your convenience. Contact us today for a custom quote.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: 4 Reasons to Rent a Climate Controlled Storage Unit in Sydney
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text]When it comes time to choose a storage unit, there are circumstances where any unit will do, particularly if you won’t be storing items for a long period of time. But there are instances when upgrading to a climate-controlled unit is advised, and it’s important to know when to make the switch. If you’re in the Sydney area and wondering whether you should spend the extra cash on a climate-controlled unit, we’ve gathered some important information that will help you make the right decision.

What’s the Difference Between a Standard and Climate-Controlled Storage Unit?

A standard storage unit is just that—a covered place to keep your belongings safe from the elements. A climate-controlled storage unit goes a step further and maintains a constant humidity level, temperature, and air quality throughout the year. Air conditioners and heaters are only used when needed to keep the temperature steady. A climate-controlled unit is not the cheapest option, costing anywhere from 35% - 50% more than a standard unit, but it just may be the unit you need depending on your circumstances and the items you’re storing.

Reasons to Rent a Climate-Controlled Storage Unit

1. You’re Storing Items Long Term

People use storage units on a short-term basis for a variety of reasons. Perhaps you’ve decided to rent a storage unit during the holidays to hold all the extra clutter until your parties are over and company leaves. Or you might be expecting guests for a few weeks and need a place to store your desk and cabinets in order to convert your office into a temporary bedroom. If you’re moving from one home to another, you may need to use a storage unit briefly while you stage your home for selling. In each of these circumstances, you’ll only need the unit for a little while and can likely get away with using a standard unit. It’s a different story when you need a unit long-term. If you’ve downsized your home and just don’t have room for your antique collection or original artwork and will need to store it for the foreseeable future, you’ll want to upgrade to a climate-controlled unit.

2. Your Items Need Protection from High Temps and Humidity

If you live in an area that experiences very high…or very low…temperatures, you’ll want to protect your items in a climate-controlled storage unit. Items like wooden furniture, antiques, or musical instruments are prone to warping or splitting when they are kept in a unit that experiences wildly changing temperatures. Books, artwork, and financial documents or paper records can also be damaged by extreme temperatures. Other items that should be protected from extreme temperatures include:
  • Upholstered furniture
  • Mattresses
  • Electronics
  • Leather furniture
  • Photographs

3. Limit Exposure to Dust and Pests

Anyone who has unloaded items that have spent months or years in storage knows—you often spend hours dusting off the thick layer of dust that can accumulate on items living in a standard storage unit. And droppings left by mice, rats, roaches and other pests are not only unpleasant, but they can also pose a health risk. Climate-controlled units tend to have excellent air filtration systems, keeping your items clean and dust free. They are also well insulated, providing sound protection against the critters that like to call standard units home.

4. You’re Storing Irreplaceable Items

There are some things you don’t want to leave exposed to the elements. If you have an extensive baseball collection, collect rare bottles of wine, or have priceless albums of old family photos, you’ll want to consider reserving a climate-controlled storage unit. As you think of the items you’re planning to store long-term, ask yourself these questions:
  • Are my items susceptible to mold or mildew?
  • Is there a chance my items will warp, crack, split, or discolor if exposed to moisture?
  • Will my items expand or contract if exposed to extreme temperatures?
  • Am I storing something that holds great sentimental value to me or my family?
If you answered yes to any of these questions, you likely need a climate-controlled storage unit. And, if the higher price of the climate-controlled units has you groaning consider this—you really are paying for the peace of mind that comes with knowing your items are being stored in the best possible atmosphere to ensure they stay in tip-top condition. If you’re looking for a high-quality storage facility in the Sydney area, we hope you’ll consider using Holloway Storage. Our friendly and experienced staff are happy to deliver one of our mobile units straight to your door. Pack at your leisure, then give us a call when you’re ready to have your unit safely stored in our facility where it will remain dry and free from mould and humidity. Contact us today for a custom quote.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: 5 Ways Holloway Storage Meets Your Long-Term Storage Needs in Sydney
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
People find themselves in need of long-term storage for a variety of reasons. Some accept a new job requiring them to live overseas temporarily. Others feel the need to downsize their home but don’t want to rush getting rid of items. Whatever the reason, if you find yourself in need of long-term storage in or around Sydney, we hope you’ll consider keeping your belongings with us at Holloway Storage. To make your decision that much easier, we’ve gathered 5 important points to consider before renting a long-term storage unit, and the reasons why renting with Holloway is the best decision you’ll make.

1. The Distance Between You and Your Storage Unit

As you begin vetting storage companies, it’s important to consider the distance between your unit and your home, especially if you will need to access your unit at some point. While you may get a better rate using a more remote storage facility, you must carefully weigh whether the price break is worth the extra drive to get there. If you live in or around Sydney, odds are good that there is a Holloway Storage facility near you. We are proud to have facilities in 11 areas of Sydney, each of which offer exceptional long-term storage units.

2. The Option of Using a Mobile Storage Unit

Consider using a storage company that offers mobile storage unit delivery. There are storage companies who will deliver an empty storage unit directly to your home, allowing you to fill the unit at your convenience. This type of service saves you precious time as you’re able to pack all at once rather than making multiple trips to fill a storage unit at a permanent location. Finding the time to move your belongings to and from a storage unit can be frustrating. That’s why Holloway offers front door delivery service. We will happily deliver an empty storage container to your property. Once you’ve filled the container, just give us a call and we’ll pick the entire unit up and store it safely at our facility.

3. Ask About the Ease of Accessing Your Unit

When it comes to accessing your long-term unit, not all storage facilities are created equal. It’s important to talk to your storage facility rep and ask about their hours of operation. Do their hours work for your schedule? For example, having your items stored at a facility that is closed on the weekends may be inconvenient, especially if you work a traditional 9 – 5 job during the work week. At Holloway, we make accessing your unit easy and convenient. Simply call the location where your unit is stored, and we will happily schedule a time for you to come by and access your unit. When you are ready to empty your unit, we can deliver yours back to your home with as little as 24-hour notice.

4. What Security Features are In Place?

Ensuring your belongings are safe while in storage should be one of your top priorities. It is important to contact any storage facility you’re considering using to ask about the security measures they have in place. It’s also a good idea to visit the location and get a look for yourself. Does the facility appear secure? Is the property properly lit in the evenings? Is the property fenced and, if so, is the fencing secure and free of holes or tears? Holloway Storage takes the security of your belongings seriously. That’s why we offer 24/7 closed-circuit-tv surveillance at all Holloway storage locations. We also employ on-site security personnel to patrol the property. We want you to know your treasured items are in good hands with Holloway.

5. Is the Facility Highly Reviewed?

There is no better indicator to the quality of a storage facility than the reviews that are left by customers who have used that facility’s services. Always take the time to ask your facility for references and to read reviews left by customers on the company’s Google Business page or social media pages. At Holloway, we’re proud of the 5-star reviews we’ve received from happy customers. You can scroll to the bottom of our website FAQ page to read a few. Or you can click here to read our reviews from our Google Business page. Expect to see plenty of complimentary terms like “friendly”, “efficient”, and “consistently excellent”. Customer service…it’s what we do at Holloway. Finding the right facility for your long-term storage needs must start with careful assessment of the storage companies in your area. Find out which company checks the most “must-have” boxes off your list of desirable features. We do hope Holloway Storage is at the top of your list. We think you’ll find our prices are competitive (we even price match so, if you find a competitor with a lower rate, just let us know!), our employees are knowledgeable and friendly…and our customer service? Well, it’s second to none. Contact us today to discuss your storage needs. Store your belongings the right way…with Holloway.

item.title: 4 Surprising Ways Renting a Self Storage Makes Working from Home Heavenly
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text]There are a million reasons why people rent storage units—in preparation for a move, to hold seasonal items like boats and ski equipment, or to keep seasonal décor out of the way. But have you ever considered renting a storage unit to make working from home easier? While it may sound unconventional, there’s no question that more people are working remotely today than ever before. According to ABC News, the percentage of Australians working from home has exploded, leaping from just 8% to 40% in the last two years due, in large part, to the COVID-19 pandemic. The problem is most of us didn’t move into our current homes or flats under the expectation that we’d be working there, and oftentimes we find ourselves trying to work in less-than-ideal conditions. But here’s the good news—renting a storage unit just might be the solution to the problem you’re wrestling with. Here’s 4 reasons why.

1. Helps You Get Rid of Home Clutter

Moving your office into your home can leave your space feeling crowded and cluttered. Free up some of that precious real estate for your office needs by renting a storage unit and moving out the superfluous stuff that is taking up space in your home. Storage units are perfect for storing extra furniture, side tables, and decorative accessories as you move in desks, office chairs, and even work equipment. Not only will decluttering your home free up space, but it will also make your residence feel more open and roomier which, in turn, makes for a more productive work environment.

2. You Can Empty Out That Guest Room

One of the most common complaints about working from home is the fact that most people are without a dedicated workspace and find it hard to take care of business from the dining room table while meals are prepared and kids are running about in the background. Let’s be honest…we’re still dealing with the fallout of an ongoing global pandemic. The odds of company coming for an overnight stay are relatively low. So, if you have a guest bedroom that hasn’t seen visitors in the last two years, why not move all of the furniture into storage and use the space to set up your office? Having an actual office will make you more productive…and having the luxury of closing a door while on conference calls or Zoom meetings is something that shouldn’t be minimised. Something to note: If you are considering storing a mattress or wooden furniture for a long period of time, consider renting a climate-controlled storage unit. It may cost a bit more than an outdoor unit, but keeping the temperature and humidity stable means a decreased likelihood that furniture will warp or crack and mattresses will suffer from mold or mildew.

3. Gives You a Place to Store Inventory

It’s one thing to work from home if you are an employee, but it’s quite another if you are a small business owner and are dealing with storing inventory while working from home. Depending on the size of your newly-converted-guest-bedroom office and the amount of inventory you possess, keeping everything at home may not be an option. Renting a storage unit allows you to keep your inventory safe and neatly organized. If you have an online storefront and will be packaging product for shipping, consider renting enough space to include a packing station in your storage unit. Another perk—when you have the luxury of extra space, you can order inventory in larger quantities and take advantage of bulk pricing discounts without wondering where you’ll keep it.

4. Provides a Safe Space for Sensitive Documents

If you are a small business owner, you likely have loads of files and paper documents that need to be safely stored. If you are no longer working out of an office, you may be reluctant to leave these important papers in a vacant space…but hesitant to bring them into your home. Documents you likely have on hand include:
  • Client Files
  • Business Plans
  • Employee Records
  • Tax and Financial Documents
  • Lease Agreements
Renting a storage unit allows you to know your documents are safe and secure and free from the grip of curious kiddos and the mouths of bored house pets. And so… As businesses and employees grow more comfortable with the idea of working remotely, there is a chance many of us could shift from temporary to permanent at-home workers. Renting a storage unit frees up the space you need to create a functional home office. If you’re ready to pull the trigger and rent a self-storage unit, we hope you’ll consider using Holloway Storage. We offer a wide range of affordable storage options, and our team of storage experts is ready and waiting to help. Make sure your belongings are stored the right way…with Holloway.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: From Your Sydney Self-Storage Specialist: Top 5 Times Renting a Storage Unit Just Makes Sense
item.dc:creator: digitalcanteen
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true" type="1_1"][fusion_text]When you live in one place around Sydney for any length of time, accumulating “stuff” is inevitable…especially if you have a family. Children may outgrow clothing and toys, but you likely find yourself unwilling to get rid of such sentimental treasures. And the pile of boxes begins to grow..and grow… Add to that the standard housewares, holiday décor, and seasonal items that most people collect over a lifetime, and you might find yourself bursting at the seams and looking for a larger home. Whether you’re planning a move or just needing to free up some space, we gathered a list of the top 5 instances when renting a storage unit just makes sense. Let’s take a look.

1. When You’re Preparing for a Move

Moving is probably one of the top reasons people choose to rent a self-storage unit. Having safe and secure locations to house all your non-essential items as you prepare your home for a move can be a life saver. Be sure to ask any storage facility you’re considering whether they offer month-to-month rentals. There’s no sense in paying for a long-term lease if you’ll only need your unit for a few weeks.

2. When You’re Staging Your Home

Ask any realtor and they’ll tell you—the proper staging of your home can make the difference between getting an offer within days of your home hitting the market and waiting for months as your home languishes on the market with nary a whiff of interest. Proper staging can make your home feel brand new and expansive, allowing potential buyers to envision themselves and their belongings easily fitting into your space. This means moving all your extra furniture and boxes out of the home to make your abode feel as roomy as possible. And, for anyone wondering…no, you cannot cram everything into the garage. Potential buyers will absolutely look there and seeing a wall of stuff perpetuates the assumption that there’s not enough space in the home. Move everything that is unnecessary, unattractive, or taking up precious space off property and into a self-storage unit. Doing so ensures that, no matter where interested parties look, all they will find is neat and orderly perfection.

3. When You Need a Safe Place for Family Heirlooms

Some of your most precious items have likely been passed down in your family through generations. Items like antique furniture, artwork, and even pianos can carry a strong connection between us and our ancestors. And, while these items hold tremendous sentimental value, they may not fit into your current décor or may be too large to display in your home. Though you may be tempted to place such items out in a garage or up in an attic space, it is important to know that exposing such pieces to fluctuating temperatures and moisture levels can be a recipe for disaster. Self-storage offers the perfect storage space for antique items you want to protect. Be sure to rent a climate-controlled unit if you will be storing wooden pieces or artwork. Units that are climate controlled maintain a regulated temperature and humidity level to ensure delicate pieces do not warp, crack, or deteriorate.

4. When Your Items Need Protection from Inclement Weather

These days it seems like unexpected weather events happen with greater regularity. From monsoons to typhoons and winter weather storms, bad weather can wreak havoc on our belongings, particularly those things we tend to store outdoors or in the garage. Items like recreational vehicles, jet skis, boats and seasonal sports equipment can fall victim to unexpected weather events. Keeping such items in storage ensures that, even when the weather takes a turn for the worse, your items will be protected. Storage units are available in a variety of sizes and can easily house an RV, trailer, jet skis, and equipment in a single large unit.

5. When You Find Yourself Suddenly Working from Home

Perhaps there is no move on your horizon, and you have no need to stage your home. You can still benefit from renting a storage unit, especially if you are like so many other Aussies who have found themselves working remotely. Many have been forced to convert what was formerly a spare bedroom into a newly appointed office, and a storage unit makes the perfect holding space for your bedroom furniture. As mentioned before, you’ll want to rent a climate-controlled unit if you plan to store a mattress, bedding, and/or wooden furniture. If you’ve decided life would be made easier by renting a storage unit, we hope you’ll contact us at Holloway Storage. We’ve been taking the hassle out of storage in Sydney for over a decade, and we’d love to have the opportunity to keep your belongings safe. You can rest assured your items will be stored the right way…with Holloway.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]
